package.name: staubli_tx60_support

description.p: ROS-Industrial support for the Staubli TX60 (and variants).
This package contains configuration data, 3D models and launch files for Staubli manipulators of the TX60 series. This includes the TX60 and the TX60L.

Joint limits, torque limits, and maximum joint velocities are based on the information in the Staubli Robotics - TX series 60 family - Instruction Manual version D28082802D â€“ 01/12/2016. All urdfs are based on the default motion and joint velocity limits, unless noted otherwise (ie: no support for high speed joints, extended / limited motion ranges or other options).
Before using any of the configuration files and / or meshes included in this package, be sure to check they are correct for the particular robot model and configuration you intend to use them with.
NB (1): Masses, center of mass and moments of inertia were calculated using Solidworks and the official Staubli CAD models, and may not be accurate.

NB (2): In order to allow maximum torque on axis 6, effort limit on axis 5 was set to 8 Nm, rather than a feasible 10 Nm if torque on axis 6 = 0 Nm (see superscripts (1) and (2) from table in Section 2.6.2 -Torque Limits- of the instruction manual for details).

package.author: Nils Melchert (Leibniz University Hannover)
package.maintainer: G.A. vd. Hoorn (TU Delft Robotics Institute)
